description: Emergency Supply & Advanced Plan. for Early Recovery-Gaza

subproject.description: This project aims to enhance resilience of the Gaza Strip residents through a) the provision of emergency livelihood support targeted at vulnerable groups and b) restoring and maintaining emergency and essential services delivery capacities and actual delivery through Civil Society Organizations (CSOs). The project will also prepare for advanced UN interagency programming, coordination and planning for early recovery through focused monitoring of socio-economic and human development impact of the crisis, early recovery analysis, coordination and setting the stage for early recovery through joint programming. The project will simultaneously provide targeted support to three elements that are directly relevant to the current situation of the targeted population: (1) the livelihood opportunities of households (especially those headed by females), providing immediate support through tangible and quick income generating schemes (2) Address the vulnerability context of special groups of the society (children, women, youth and the disabled) in terms of deteriorating education and health standards, increasing psychosocial problems and limited opportunities for the youth to engage in meaningful activities and (3) Preparing for the recovery stage through early recovery planning and coordination as well as actual programming and delivery of interagency initiatives.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Early Recovery-Gaza (BCPR)

subproject.title: Early Recovery-Gaza (BCPR)

subproject.description:
• Quick-impact livelihood support provided to households through enrollment in tangible and quick income generating schemes.
• Essential services capacities maintained and supported through CSOs, addressing vulnerability context of special groups in the areas of education, health and psychosocial healing. 
• Young men and women integrated in meaningful and income generating activities as a means to promote social cohesion and reduce tension and violence.
• Advanced UN interagency programming, coordination and planning for comprehensive early recovery
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Early Recovery-Gaza (UAE)

subproject.description:
The project’s aim is to enhance the resilience of the Gaza Strip residents through supporting agro- productivity and livelihoods based interventions, rehabilitation of destroyed agriculture facilities, in addition to enhance access to basic services through rehabilitation of damaged electricity networks and enhancing the delivery of power supply in the Gaza Strip. The project’s aim is to enhance the resilience of the Gaza Strip residents through supporting agro- productivity and livelihoods based interventions, rehabilitation of destroyed agriculture facilities, in addition to enhance access to basic services through rehabilitation of damaged electricity networks and enhancing the delivery of power supply in the Gaza Strip. The project comes are a response to the urgent needs of the Palestinian population following the late Israeli military assault on the Gaza Strip. The military assault inflicted large scale of damages on the infrastructure including agriculture and electricity facilities.  The project was deigned to immediately restore damaged agriculture and electricity facilities through the procurement and installation of new equipments and spare parts. 
As for the electricity intervention, the objective of the urgent support to energy sector is to increase the amount of power evacuation for Gaza Power Generating Plant via the Gaza West Transformers Substation by additional (40 MW) added capacity.   The electricity support intervention composes of following two main activities:
1. Rehabilitation of Gaza Power Generating Plant by supplying and installing two step up and two step down transformers, one complete transformer bay including protection, control, civil works and the recommended spare parts.
2. Supply and install electricity disrtibution and transport networks in all Gaza Strip.
subproject.title: Urgent Support-Agr. & Elec.IDB

subproject.description: Provide immediate humanitarian relief to internally displaced registered non-refugee Palestinian families whose homes were destroyed in the Gaza Strip through the provision of cash assistance and to strictly compensate Palestinian’s in the Gaza Strip for their direct losses as a result of the Israeli military operation which started on 27 December 2008 and lasted until 18 January 2009.
subproject.title: Cash Assistance -PMO

subproject.description:
This project comes as an immediate response of the international community’s efforts to restoring the livelihoods of the population of Gaza in the crisis affected areas in Gaza as a result of Israeli cast lead operation during the period of December 26, 2008 - January 18, 2009.
 
On March 31, 2009, the United Nations Development Programme / Programme of Assistance to the Palestinian People (UNDP/PAPP) and Canadian International Development Agency (CIDA) signed an Agreement through which CIDA has entrusted UNDP/PAPP with a grant of CAD 4,000,000 for the implementation of Gaza UXOs and Rubble Removal project.  

The main objective of the project is to reduce the threats on the Gaza population resulting from the existence of UXOs underneath rubble, and safeguarding the environment. The project activities involve deconstruction, collecting and crushing of collected rubble concrete.

UNDP/PAPP as the coordinator of early recovery/environment sub-cluster formulated a Rubble Task Force (RTF) committee aimed at up-scaling agencies’ interventions and sharing information in relation to rubble removal activities. The RTF comprises rubble removal actors such as CHF, NRC, UNRWA, and others. The committee convenes every month where each actor provides update on progress, planned activities and challenges. The report covers achieved project targets by these actors according to Joint Action Plan
subproject.title: Gaza Rubble Removal - CIDA

subproject.description:
On July, 2009, the United Nations Development Programme / Programme of Assistance to the Palestinian People (UNDP/PAPP) and the Government of Sweden through (SIDA) agency signed an Agreement through which SIDA has entrusted UNDP/PAPP with a grant of SEK 18 Million (Nearly US$ 2,380,331) for the implementation of Gaza UXOs and Rubble Removal project.  

In March 2010, the Government of Sweden has entrusted UNDP for an additional fund of 20 Million SEK (Nearly US$2,687,840) to cover all remaining UXOs and rubble removal activities from all areas in the Gaza Strip. UNDP has submitted new proposal through amendment of on-going agreement between UNDP and SIDA. This amendment covers new rubble removal from Middle, Khanyounis and Rafah area, and then crushing of removed concrete rubble in order to be used in rehabilitation of damaged roads in Gaza Strip. According to the new amendment, two new contracts for rubble removal from Middle and Southern governorates and one contract for road rehabilitation are signed.

the planned outputs of the project are:
1.An amount of 138,000 tons removed rubble deconstructed, sorted and transported.
2.A total of 100,000 tons of concrete rubble is crushed.
3. A total of  25 km of rural roads is rehabilitated by utilizing crushed material and 44,700 square meters of interlock tiles and 5,800 meter installed
4. UXOs are cleared and disposed safely
5.Hazardous materials are separated and disposed in an environmentally sound manner
subproject.title: North Rubble Removal-SIDA

subproject.title: North Rubble Removal-SIDA

subproject.description: The project aims at reducing threats to public health through clearance and safe disposal of UXOs, removing accumulated rubbles and improving solid waste collection in the Gaza Strip. Palestinian people’s livelihood in the Gaza Strip and their access to essential services were severely impacted as a result of the Israeli bombardment and military operations during the period December 2008-January 2009. A total of 600,000 tons of rubble was generated and more than 25,000 tons of municipal solid waste accumulated at random dump sites closed to residential areas which pose serious threats to the public health. The overall situation of solid waste management in the Gaza Strip is weak due to weakened local authorities as a result of lack of financial and technical capacity and inadequate infrastructure for proper collection, treatment and disposal of municipal solid waste. The project will generate more than 400,000 working days opportunities to residents of the affected areas, improving farmers accessibility ; collection of solid waste and promotion of composting and recycling.
subproject.title: UXO's clreance&improvement SWM

subproject.description: This project aims to support advanced UN early recovery coordination and interagency programming, for comprehensive and multi-stakeholder early recovery through focused monitoring of socio-economic and human development impact of the crisis, early recovery analysis, coordination and setting the stage for early recovery through joint programming. This two-year initiative shall set the stage for a comprehensive early recovery multi-stakeholder response, with impact on all areas of the Gaza Strip. This proposal will be incorporated into the existing project “Rapid Support to Livelihoods and Social Services in Gaza and Advanced Planning for Early Recovery”, as a revision / expansion of its Output 4.
subproject.title: UN Early Recovery Coordination

This proposal will be incorporated into the existing project “Rapid Support to Livelihoods and Social Services in Gaza and Advanced Planning for Early Recovery”, as a revision / expansion of its Output 4.
subproject.title: UN Early Recovery Coordination
